reviews.text: Go early to beat the crowds and before it gets too hot. You may even be lucky enough to see dolphins
Great views, can be busy
Neat but found places just as beautiful and less crowded while driving Gold Coast to Melbourne
Lovely spot. Not for grey nomads though. Young crowd.
Awesome  views...

Excellent, light, airy store, convenient to local area & town centre. 
1 hour free parking, currently under new building next door. 
Open until midnight 😋
Can buy as little quantity as we need, unlike another local store where so much is sold in large packs only. 
A little pricey but quality fare.

They sell grocery store things. Including but not limited to, groceries. They have an aisle for pets and cleaning. They have an aisle of stuff to buy that you can cook your groceries in. 
If you like groceries. This is it folks.
"The Place"
Best supermarket ever. The shelves were all oddly satisfyingly filled
Great fresh food, new Woolies in Byron I never thought I'd see the day. Now with under  ground parking, parcel pick up and lovely staff.

This star is for the staff who are all super cool. But the price of the fruit and veg is astounding. I'm trying to boycott the horrible soulless place completely. Got rid of plastic bags... Replaced them with bigger, thicker, stronger (longer lasting plastic) bags... ? Avoid at all costs. Go to the farmers market on a Thursday morning. Remove the supermarket giant.

Not particularly stylish, but not rough. Plenty of people in all the time, probably because of the great live music they have on. One word of warning is that they take cash only at the bar,  don't worry though as they have an Atm. Dartboard, pool table. Reasonable food menu, pretty cheap but nice enough.
GREAT VIBE ! I used to drop by here on a Sunday afternoon to catch some great live music. The food and drinks were pretty good !

Really tasty food and interesting menu at a reasonable price. There is fun live music every night and it's a reliable go-to for a relaxing evening in Byron Bay. They also have a good range of beers on tap. Indoor and outdoor seating, but the picnic tables outside are best.
The best Atmosphere! Friendly Service. Great tasting Food.

My husband and I always visit the Railway Friendly Bar when we are holidaying in Byron, like its title it has a warm friendly atmosphere, the food is good and prices are decent. Last time we were in Byron we visited the Bar in the evening and the place was hopping with live music it was lots of fun for young and old alike.

Love this place so much! Everything is fantastic from their delicious salads and bowls to great breakfast options, and their coffees, teas, other drinks and desserts are so so good. The decor is minimal but super aesthetically pleasing and beautiful. Overall nice relaxing atmosphere. Went here multiple times during our vacation and it was really excellent every time.

Really didn't understand this cafe, it caters to specific group of humans. Although it's always busy and you get service and you will get what you pay for. Specialty coffee is served and an open kitchen serves a common menu with locally resourced ingredients. The service is casual and it's a must visit place in Byron bay.

Ideal spot for Vegans or anyone health conscious - they have a great selection of breakfast and lunch items and some really interesting hot/cold drinks. The staff were all really friendly and helpful. I had the dukkha poached eggs which were delicious (big serving) and friends enjoyed the scrambled special. Their juices were really tasty too.

I spent a long time until a waiter came to take my order. A long time was spent until my coffee was brought. I understand that this place is busy but there are a good number of staff work in it. So, the service is slower than it is necessary. I wouldn’t like to much.

The attention to detail at the trendy spot is second to none. The Coffee is served so carefully and is arranged so that the spoon is always facing you. They serve sparkling water to cleanse you palate if you’re having a black coffee too. The food is delicious and I can’t fault it. I’ve had so many meals here and all are great. The staff are so attentive and the bathrooms are clean although you have to walk through a tight space around the back to get there. The patrons are all super kind there too and it feels like the type of place you’d want to start your day at every day. Overall this is a must visit and I’m going to miss this spot the most when I leave Byron.

Amazing! From being greeted so warmly before we entered to leaving - the staff were so friendly. And the food was exceptional, best fish + chips my husband and i have had. Could not recommend this more! :)

The fish tacos are amazingly good, so fresh and tasty when piping hot. Chips were perfect. The calamari and octopus were equally fantastic. The staff were super nice and helpful with recommendations. Nice dude at register even suggested we take our food to the beach and enjoy the vibe there, which was awesome advice!
So consistent. These guys deliver delicious food that is well presented. I've been coming here for years and they've never skipped a beat :)

Ate here the other night with two girlfriends, the staff could not be more welcoming and accomodating. The food is beautiful but when the service is amazing, it lifts the whole experience. Thanks for making our trip to Byron even better Nathan and Charlotte :)

Potentially Beautiful food. Great size too. A shame the salad was bland... and you’re forced to buy extra sauces to cover it. I ordered two $20 bowls of fish and salad with a side of chips, spending $50 all up for two people, the salad dressing sauce that comes with it served on the side in a little plastic container wasn’t enough to cover the salad, when I asked for a splash of balsamic or something to make it more tasty I was told it would be an extra $1 for another quarter filled plastic container. I couldn’t just get my container refilled with a couple of extra drops. I had already bought an extra tomato sauce for the chips. And felt this extra cost for dressing completely unreasonable. (And a waste of plastic.) The staff were unwilling to provide and also quite rude. As a local for 15 years who has been to this restaurant many times, I’m really disappointed in this new swing of bad customer service. I won’t be taking my visitors back here again after this treatment. Business lost over a matter of $1 badly played fish mongers. I ended up eating my salad at home so I could put a splash of balsamic vinegar on it myself.

It's more of a hotel than a restaurant. Right on the beach at Wategos. Serene atmosphere. Clean rooms and nice staff. I was pretty happy with the service but the food and beverage was a let down. I recommend getting the food out in the town and the coffee from the kiosk just out side the venue.
Stunning location and facilities. The best part? The staff. So attentive and accommodating. The little details delighted and surprised us frequently. Restaurant food was excellent.

Went here for a lovely dinner expecting some amazing food after reading other reviews. The location is stunning, the service was great and unfortunately that’s where it ends. We had high expectations and the prices on the menu would suggest the same. I had the fish of the day and it was bland and dry. It came with a side of creamed corn and THAT’S ALL! No herbs, no lemon, no oil, no sauce. Just dry fish. Also had a side of potato scallops which were just as dry and bland. My wife had the mushroom agnolotti which taste good however the serving wouldn’t even be enough for our 7 year old. Don’t waste your money!

Loved Rae's. My friends and I opted for dinner and I was a little surprised it wasn't as busy as I expected but then again it didn't bother us as we had great service by the staff and of course had amazing food and wine. 3 single girls eating at an amazing restaurant overlooking Wategos beach in Byron, what more could you ask for. Ended the might with some limoncello shots by the staff, went down well. Look forward to coming back during the day.

We stayed at Raes recently to celebrate a wedding anniversary. We had three nights but wished we'd booked for longer. Our room was huge and beautifully designed. The bed was very comfy and the setting felt like home immediately. We loved sitting on our little balcony before and after dinner each evening. 
We spent a couple of afternoons by the pool. With so few guest rooms it felt like our private pool - very indulgent.
The location was perfect for us. We walked into town a couple of times, walked up to the lighthouse before breakfast on two mornings and being right on the beach enjoyed a swim in the beautifully warm ocean.
Breakfast in the restaurant each morning was a real treat, and our dinner  at Raes was also an eating highlight.
If I had to pick one thing that stood out above all else it would be the staff. They are all so genuine, caring, friendly, natural and at the same time polished and service minded. We can't rate them highly enough.
We will be back.

Loved this place. I'm vegan and when I asked what I can have, the lovely girl gave me everything except one thing which was a vegetarian lasagne that had cheese in it. The food was absolutely beautiful and so filling! I had a vegan bliss ball for dessert which was amazing too. Looking forward to come back here next time I'm in Byron.

Amazing food! Full of flavour and great prices. If you’re after a cheap bite this is the place to go to. Tucked away in a little alleyway so if you are after atmosphere this isn’t the place. But the food more than makes up for it!
Great food and even better service. The last time I went here 2 years ago, and the food is just as good as I remember.

The little plate is filling enough for me. For 12'50 I tried the basmati rice with the Dahl and koftas. The koftas were the worst that I had never tried. The Dahl was okey. But I won't comeback. I wouldn't pay again for that food.
Great vegetarian food at non tourist prices. I could eat there every day.

Right in front of the ocean, good food and good coffee. The staff are polite and the service is almost fine dining oriented. If you are in Byron and love to watch all the action unfold while you eat this is a good place to visit.

Popped in for lunch a couple of times and was impressed both times. The food was high quality every time and the location was excellent. They were helpful with the gluten free member of the group and the staff were quite good. The service was a bit slow but they were also VERY busy both times we were there so it is understandable and the service staff did everything they could. I would definitely recommend Fishheads for a a weekend lunch if you're in Byron.

Had take away a few times ..prob the best calamari I've ever had. There is always a wait but that's fair enough for the fish and chips shop on the main beach. Today we sat down and had lunch. The sea breeze was beautiful the food was beautiful and the waiter lovely. Thanks guys.

Tried to have lunch at Fishheads with my family, we were seated not long after we arrived and given our menus. We waited and waited to have our order taken, tried to get the eye of the waiter who seated us, then went to the bar and tried to order and were told to sit down and we would be given a menu by the same person who originally gave us the menus. We explained we were given menus  and were ready to order. Another 10 minutes passed when we tried to get the same waiters attention while he talked to everyone around us. The restaurant is in a great spot and I’m sure the food is fine but we will never know as eventually left without being serviced.
We had a late lunch here. The location is great being just across from the main beach. The views are great and the food is sensational.  We really enjoyed our lunch.

The place is so beautiful and you can enjoy of an amazing views. I think is great to drink a coffee while you see the sea. Moreover, it has good prices and the staff are super kind. I went alone and the waiter didn’t have any problem in offering me one table opposite the sea. I felt very grateful with this because I have to take the worse place for going alone.

Just a bit off the mark ..

Great view of ocean.
The Menu and wine list looked the goods .. 

But ..

Seafood was chewy and pasta undercooked
Waitress was pushing us to get out and loved to upsell. 

All in all great opportunity to be something great but failed tonight.

Ignore the bad reviews, this place is divine. Very tasty food, worth the price and the service was impeccable. I had the mozzarella and steak, both constructed to perfection. The atmosphere was calm yet buzzing, with the sea crashing in the back round. Would come again.

P.s Authentic Italian management, they know what they're doing!

The food tasted nice but was overpriced and overrated. I had the ceviche starter, prawns and radicchio salad. 

It was flavourful, but the prawns were difficult to eat and didn’t have much meat at the end of the day. 

The atmosphere was beautiful and the service was good but slow - took us an hour to get our meals. 

To make it worse we went to town after lunch and saw $8 tacos that looked just as tasty and would have been much more filling. 

So short recommendation is go into town and get better value for money.

Love this place! A big favourite of ours when we visit Byron Bay. You just can't beat the view, the service or the food. There is such a great ambience in this venue that we decided to hold our wedding recovery brunch here and it was so beautiful, a truly memorable occasion. Thank you so much Beach Byron team for your great service. We'll be back again next year! Sarah

Great spot to grab some lunch in the heart of Byron! Right on the beach, great open area undercover and a cute outdoor patio area. Highly recommend checking out this spot. I personally prefer it during the day, it’s not as crowded as it is at night. 
The food is really good too!! Just a tip if you’re traveling and trying to save money.. I ordered from the kids menu and ordered the fish and chips which was a decent amount with a side salad and it was cheaper than the regular fish and chips and just as filling. 
Highly recommend checking out this spot. 
The bar is also amazing. Great beer selection and good mixed drinks.
Retty awesome place to chill, huge beer garden. Constant entertainment. Very lively atmosphere. Awesome music acts and live performances, also you can get a really good feed here as well.

We found this gem while visiting Byron Bay and really enjoyed our stay.  The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because the front of the hotel is oddly empty.  It's as if there had been another business in the space and now strange and empty.  The reception is all the in the back and a little tricky to find.  The room was clean and bright with a large balcony facing the pool.  The small kitchenette had a sink chiller, and a kettle with a nice selection of teas.  The pool is very nice and our family enjoyed it since the blue bottles kept us off the beach.
Favourite spot for a Sunday afternoon session. Great food and amazing atmosphere in an amazing location

Spacious bar with a couple of large outdoor areas. Quick service at the bar, nice staff. Big screen in the corner of one of the beer gardens. Great pizza oven fired up ready to cook up a decent pizza in no time.

Not particularly stylish, but not rough. Plenty of people in all the time, probably because of the great live music they have on. One word of warning is that they take cash only at the bar,  don't worry though as they have an Atm. Dartboard, pool table. Reasonable food menu, pretty cheap but nice enough.
GREAT VIBE ! I used to drop by here on a Sunday afternoon to catch some great live music. The food and drinks were pretty good !

Really tasty food and interesting menu at a reasonable price. There is fun live music every night and it's a reliable go-to for a relaxing evening in Byron Bay. They also have a good range of beers on tap. Indoor and outdoor seating, but the picnic tables outside are best.
The best Atmosphere! Friendly Service. Great tasting Food.

My husband and I always visit the Railway Friendly Bar when we are holidaying in Byron, like its title it has a warm friendly atmosphere, the food is good and prices are decent. Last time we were in Byron we visited the Bar in the evening and the place was hopping with live music it was lots of fun for young and old alike.
